name: United Kingdom National E-invoicing Forum
goal:
The UK National e-Invoicing Forum was set up in 2010 as a self-funded initiative of industry associations, public sector bodies and solution providers to promote e-Invoicing in the UK public and private sectors; and also to ensure expert UK input to the EU Commission Multi-Stakeholder Forum on e-Invoicing, so that emerging EU policy - and its implementation - supports UK public and private interests.

Mission: “To save the UK tax-payer money and
improve service quality and transparency by replacing
paper invoices with wholly electronic transactions.”

Objectives:

1. Support for Government Policy Making: to engage with the Crown Commercial
Service and provide expert opinion on the implementation of electronic
invoicing by the UK Public Sector as described in the Small Business Enterprise
and Employment Act. The forum intends to argue the case for an ‘e-invoicing/e-procurement
champion’, who will be responsible for advising on existing EU
directives and for delivering widespread e-invoicing adoption across the UK
public sector. Another key area is the creation of an ‘e-invoicing national
framework agreement’ that is re-usable across all public sector entities. The
forum believes that the creation of a framework will increase the adoption of e-invoicing.

2. Awareness and Implementation Support for Buyers and Suppliers: to
champion, promote and advocate widespread adoption of electronic invoicing
within the context of growing supply chain automation and end-to-end
electronic transactions between buyers and sellers of goods and services.
interests: Banking and financial services, Business and Industry, Customs, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Public Health, Single market, Taxation, Trade, Trans-European Networks, Transport
euInitiatives:
Support for e-Invoicing by DG GROW as part of the Single Market and Digital Agendas.

Representation in the European Multi-Stakeholder Forum on e-Invoicing (EMSFEI).

Implementation of Directive 2014/55/EU

The work on implementation and maintenance of the European Norm for a core e-invoice
